Expectation1: Maintain a friendly and approachable demeanor
Situation1: The acquaintance passes another person in a quiet hallway.
Situation2: They encounter a customer trying to return an item without a receipt and need to apply the store’s return policy.
Story: I was walking down the quiet hallway at work when I spotted Jamie, someone I know from my apartment building. We’ve always exchanged friendly hellos, and I could tell from the way Jamie smiled that she expected the same warmth from me. But as I got closer, I realized she was holding a shopping bag from the store where I work as a cashier. My heart sank when she pulled out a sweater and explained she wanted to return it, but didn’t have the receipt. As a cashier, I’m supposed to strictly follow the store’s return policy—no returns without a receipt, no exceptions. Jamie looked at me, clearly hoping I’d bend the rules just this once. I could feel the tension building inside me. On one hand, I wanted to be the friendly, approachable acquaintance she knew, but on the other, I was expected to uphold the store’s policies. My mind raced, torn between disappointing a friend and risking trouble at work.
